AD_HalflingReport.synopsis: A flaming fist takes a half
AD_HalflingReport.how_to_trigger: - Go to -6.5; 58; -95- Dialogue should start automatically between the flaming fist and halfling duo.

Halfling_0.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
Halfling_0.text: The missing redcaps will find a stray cat or two to nibble on, and be back home in a jiffy - you'll see.

Halfling_1.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
Halfling_1.text: All this kerfuffle over missing redcaps! Yes, we'd caged them due to... unruly behaviour, but - as our redcap cleaners demonstrate - most are perfectly harmless!

FlamingFist_0.speaker: Fist Patrick
FlamingFist_0.text: Keep a sharp eye out - redcaps are on the loose, ones deemed 'too violent' to work. And not one of these circus folk seem bothered by it.
FlamingFist_0.context: NodeContext: worried, shocked at the circus' negligence

FlamingFist_1.speaker: Fist Patrick
FlamingFist_1.text: Bloodthirsty redcaps on the loose were the last thing I needed today.
FlamingFist_1.context: NodeContext: worried, shocked at the circus' negligence

AD_HalflingReport_1.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
AD_HalflingReport_1.text: More than a handful, less than a bundle.

AD_HalflingReport_15.speaker: Fist Patrick
AD_HalflingReport_15.text: How many redcaps are in a 'handful'?

AD_HalflingReport_7.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
AD_HalflingReport_7.text: Enough to clean Crimson's cage but not enough to organise the wine - Madam Lucretious is very particular.
AD_HalflingReport_7.context: NodeContext: confidentally with a smile (he thinks he's being helpful, he's absolutely not)

AD_HalflingReport_8.speaker: Fist Patrick
AD_HalflingReport_8.text: Sir, precisely how many redcaps are missing?
AD_HalflingReport_8.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doing his best to keep his cool

AD_HalflingReport_12.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
AD_HalflingReport_12.context: NodeContext: confused more than anything else (in his mind, he's being very clear)

AD_HalflingReport_6.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
AD_HalflingReport_6.text: I just told you! A handful!
AD_HalflingReport_6.context: NodeContext: confused more than anything else (in his mind, he's being very clear)

AD_HalflingReport_4.speaker: Fist Patrick
AD_HalflingReport_4.text: Why were these particular redcaps caged?

AD_HalflingReport_0.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
AD_HalflingReport_0.text: We had an unfortunate incident involving a child's fingers.
AD_HalflingReport_0.context: NodeContext: a grimace, but clearly doesn't think it's a big dig

AD_HalflingReport_11.speaker: Fist Patrick
AD_HalflingReport_11.text: They attacked a child? You should have killed the little monsters.

AD_HalflingReport_14.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
AD_HalflingReport_14.text: They were provoked! The child was poking and prodding them while they were trying to work.

AD_HalflingReport_9.speaker: Fist Patrick
AD_HalflingReport_9.text: I should arrest you all for gross negligence.
AD_HalflingReport_9.context: NodeContext: breath through his nose at the beginning as he regains his professional composure

AD_HalflingReport_5.speaker: Fist Patrick
AD_HalflingReport_5.text: When did you realise the redcaps had escaped?

AD_HalflingReport_13.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
AD_HalflingReport_13.text: Paramidious, one of our Redcap cleaners, alerted me. Well, he threw a rock at me and said 'GRAAH', but I got his meaning.

AD_HalflingReport_2.speaker: Fist Patrick
AD_HalflingReport_2.text: Sorry, you have redcaps working in your circus?

AD_HalflingReport_10.speaker: Edmundis Magarus
AD_HalflingReport_10.text: Oh yes, Paramidious and Fred are cleaners. They've just joined but are settling in marvellously.
